ai.summary: Lecale Way is an 11.5 km moderate hike in the UK, offering varied countryside walking with options for coastal or inland scenery depending on the route taken. The trail typically takes around 4–5 hours at a moderate pace and passes through a mix of fields, lanes, and rural paths.
ai.terrain_summary: The route features mixed terrain: grassy fields and compacted paths, occasional stiles and gates, rural roads, and gentle ascents. Footing can be uneven in places and weather may affect ground conditions, so sturdy boots are advised.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather forecasts and tide times where applicable. Wear sturdy footwear, bring layers and rain protection, and carry a map or GPS. Stay on marked paths, keep to rights of way, and plan for daylight hours. Pack a small first aid kit and enough water and snacks. Respect wildlife and farm boundaries, and inform someone of your plan.
recommended_gear: First aid kit and emergency whistle
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) generally offers milder weather and longer daylight, though the route can be walked year-round with proper gear.

seo.title: Lecale Way Hike – 11.5 km Moderate Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Lecale Way, an 11.5 km moderate hike in the UK. Learn about the terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and what gear to bring for a rewarding countryside walk.
